songTitle: Hò ru em cảnh dương (quảng bình)

phrases.text: Bồng bồng bồng bồng Bồng bồng bồng bồng Hò ơ

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "hò" - work song - sung while laboring (rowing, farming, etc.). This narrative phrase advances the story, grounding the emotional content in concrete imagery. Work songs from Central and Southern Vietnam, sung during communal labor.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice
Often featured call-and-response between workers to maintain rhythm
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
culturalContext.musicalContext: This narrative phrase contains 10 syllables, longer than typical, allowing for extended melodic development. Narrative phrases typically use moderate melodic range and steady rhythm to advance the story. Strong rhythmic foundation matching physical work movements.

phrases.text: Một mình anh ơ cả chống liễn chèo Lấy ai tát nước ơ

culturalContext.description: This phrase features "Anh" - older brother or romantic male partner. This narrative phrase advances the story, grounding the emotional content in concrete imagery. Work songs from Central and Southern Vietnam, sung during communal labor.
facts: Hò songs helped coordinate physical labor like rowing boats or pounding rice
Often featured call-and-response between workers to maintain rhythm
Vietnamese folk songs preserve oral traditions passed down through generations without written notation
Dan Tranh (16-string zither) arrangements of folk songs are relatively modern adaptations of vocal traditions
